justification: The article states: “An affect rating can be obtained by asking: ‘On a scale from 1 (= not at all) to 10 (= extremely), how upset would you be if you experienced insomnia as a side effect of a medication?’ … participants used a slider to indicate the amount of (negative) affect … on a 1-100 scale.”

topic_or_construct: Subjective value of a non-monetary outcome
justification: It notes that “measuring and representing the subjective value of any kind of outcome in terms of obtained monetary equivalents (or willingness-to-pay responses) is the standard approach in behavioral economics (and a key element of the contingent valuation approach).”

The method section explains: “As preregistered, we used the proportional dwell time on probabilities to measure the trial-level amount of attention to probabilities,” which was obtained with eye tracking.

measured_by: Proportion of choices of the riskier option
justification: For behavioral analysis the authors state: “As a measure of risk aversion, we analyzed the proportions of choices of the riskier drug … A lower proportion indicates higher risk aversion.”

measured_by: Curvature parameter γ of the probability weighting function
justification: Describing CPT, the paper says: “The parameter γ ∈ [0, 1] controls the curvature of the probability weighting function and captures the decision maker's sensitivity to probability differences, with higher values indicating higher probability sensitivity.”
